Video Settings - Screen reader - Wifi Only Toggle button ON
Video Settings - Screen reader - Wifi Only Toggle button ON
Out Of App Promotional Rails
section.description: The new beam product will feature out of app promotional rails where we will be passing content rails from the app to the partner.

section.name: Samsung CW rail
section.description: The purpose for this task is to integrate Discovery+ content in to Samsung Universal Guide Continue Watching Feature. Our intention is to allow Samsung the ability to display Discovery+ content within the aggregated “Continue Watching” feature from outside of our App.

section.name: Amazon Partner Managed Row
section.description: Your app can send recommendations to users about the content (movies, shows, music, games) that you want them to watch. For most developers, your recommendations will appear on a shared Recommended By Your Apps row on the Amazon Fire TV home screen. For information about the shared recommendations row, see Recommendations.

section.name: Android Watch Next channel (LRAP)
section.description: As a user, I should be able to watch the recently played/ watched show in ‘Play next’ rail shown on AndroidTV Home screen so that the show would be easily accessible.

section.name: Human / Machine : ML for End Card
Title Relevance & Exploration : Watched Content Suppression: Rail level
Human / Machine : Promotion in immersive Hero
[Partner Activation] Web/STB Partner Linking Flows - Errors on Redirect
section.description: As a user I want to be messaged if I don't have an entitlement for Beam or if something goes wrong during the linking flow.

section.name: [Partner Activation] Web Partner Linking Flows - watching
section.description: As a user I want to be able to start streaming content after finishing the 'profile' step.

section.name: [Partner Activation] STB Sign In - Ready to watch
[Partner Activation] STB Content Management - Configurable flows / Partner Contracts
[Partner Activation] STB Partner Linking Flows - New Customers
Backgrounding the App
section.description: As part of feature parity, we need to support platforms that offer backgrounding of our app across devices. This allows the user to warm start the app when there is enough memory to keep our apps active in the background. When the user hits the home button on the remote and exit to the partner OS, upon returning to the app, they should be on the last screen where they left off.

section.name: Samsung Multitasking Row
section.description: Samsung has launched a new feature part of the OS called Multitasking which allows you to save the application state when the user launches another application or TV channel, and to restore it when the application is resumed. You can also monitor for changes in the visibility of your application.

section.name: Amazon Background app
section.description: Amazon allows the app to be background simply by pressing the home button on the remote

section.name: General
section.description:
Got confirmation from Dick that below attributes are not required to be seen on the client side. These are fields being managed by Data Platform for their table:
subtype typeprefix receivedtimestamp trackingcode experiment

section.name: Page Performance
section.description: Client apps need to send Performance Mark and Measures events using the Instrumentation SDK API so that page performance metrics are emitted correctly.

section.name: Sign in / Sign up Frontend Development

step.content:
+ Launch the web app.Sign in with existing / new user
+ Land on home page.
+ Sign out of the app.
+ Sign back in.
step.expected:
* After successful creation, a registered user logs in and lands on home page.
* User should be able to sign out and then sign back in.New user creates account successfully.
* After successful creation, a registered user logs in and lands on home page.
* User should be able to sign out and then sign back in.

step.content:
+ Launch the web app.Sign in with existing / new user
+ Land on home page.
+ Sign out of the app.
+ Sign back in.
step.expected:
* After successful creation, a registered user logs in and lands on home page.
* User should be able to sign out and then sign back in.New user creates account successfully.
* After successful creation, a registered user logs in and lands on home page.
* User should be able to sign out and then sign back in.

step.content: * Select the purchase plan and purchase.
step.expected:
* Registered user purchases plan successfully.
* After successful plan purchase, a registered user logs in and lands on home page.
* User should be able to sign out and then sign back in.

step.content: * Select the purchase plan and purchase.
step.expected:
* Registered user purchases plan successfully.
* After successful plan purchase, a registered user logs in and lands on home page.
* User should be able to sign out and then sign back in.

step.content:
+ Sign in with the test creds.
+ Go to the test asset, play video.
+ Pause the video, then play.
+ FF, RWD the video , then play.
step.expected:
+ Authenticated users should be able to play any video.
+ User should be able to pause, skip forward, and skip backward on video.

step.content:
+ Sign in with the test creds.
+ Go to the test asset, play video.
+ Pause the video, then play.
+ FF, RWD the video , then play.
step.expected:
+ Authenticated users should be able to play any video.
+ User should be able to pause, skip forward, and skip backward on video.

test.title: Authenticated user plays video with ad

step.content:
* Sign in with the test creds.
* Go to the test asset, play an asset with ads.
* Pause the video, then play.
* FF, RWD the video, then play.
step.expected:
* Ad free users should not be able to see any ad while playing the video.
* Ad lite users should see the ad.

step.content:
* Sign in with the test creds.
* Go to the test asset, play an asset with ads.
* Pause the video, then play.
* FF, RWD the video, then play.
step.expected:
* Ad free users should not be able to see any ad while playing the video.
* Ad lite users should see the ad.

step.content:
* Sign in with the test creds.
* Click on search, search for an asset.
* Search results should be seen.
step.expected: * User should be able to search content.

step.content:
* Sign in with the test creds.
* Click on search, search for an asset.
* Search results should be seen.
step.expected: * User should be able to search content.

test.title: Authenticated user can create a profile

step.content:
+ sign in, user is on the profile screen.
+ Click on 'Manage Profiles', and add new profile.
step.expected: + Authenticated user should be able to create a profile.

step.content:
+ sign in, user is on the profile screen.
+ Click on 'Manage Profiles', and add new profile.
step.expected: + Authenticated user should be able to create a profile.

test.title: Authenticated user - Verify My list functionality

step.content:
* sign in with valid user creds.
* Add Shows to MyList from Home / Browse/Search Page.
* Click on 'MyList' menu and verify the shows added in previous steps are listed.
step.expected: * Added shows should be listed under 'My List'.

step.content:
* sign in with valid user creds.
* Add Shows to MyList from Home / Browse/Search Page.
* Click on 'MyList' menu and verify the shows added in previous steps are listed.
step.expected: * Added shows should be listed under 'My List'.

test.title: Authenticated user can edit their profile details

step.content:
* sign in with authenticated user.
* Click on 'Manage Profiles', and click on edit to edit the profile.
step.expected: * Authenticated user should be able to edit their profile details.

step.content:
* sign in with authenticated user.
* Click on 'Manage Profiles', and click on edit to edit the profile.
step.expected: * Authenticated user should be able to edit their profile details.
